page.title: 17REACTION TO AMBLE TOWN PLAN
page.content: The{1985 Amble Town Plan}deals with: the development and modernisation of housing;improved transport facilities; encouragement of industry;community development; the promotion of tourism. A questionnaire was compiled- of those interviewed{48%}agreed with the idea for{a holiday village}at Amble, but {80%}opposed{expanding caravan sites. {80%}wanted the{encouragement of B & B. {76%}favoured{a marina on the Braid. {Everyone}thought{industry should be {encouraged}but opinion was split over expanding the industrial estate.{ {60%}wanted{industry in other areas. {80%}were in{favour of renovating older {properties}but{64% wanted more houses. {84%}supported{the Amble bypass}and{80% wanted more{carparks.The majority were {for the Plan,}compiled by the County Council{to enhance the environment and {increase employment opportunities.
